body.p: “I picked up two arrowheads amid oyster and clam shells by a rock at the head of the creek opposite R.’s. One was of peculiar form “,” quite blunt and small “,” thus: [image] of quartz “,” apparently to knock over small game without break the skin.”
PE 11, pg. 394 / 23 April-6 September 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:27 / T vol. # XXI / PDF # XIV / JVIII & JIX
